title: It's a rare occasion folks
body:
Decided to play one last game before I went to bed last night.

In something that happens once in a lifetime (or so it legitimately feels) not only do we lose early game. We lose early, mid and late game as everyone but myself (support) and the adc (ashe) feed constantly. 

But lo and behold. Nobody raging at the jungler, nobody spamming /ff. Nobody AFK's. Nobody builds tears. Nobody starts feeding even more. Nobody says anything at all.

Instead the most amazing thing happens. We stayed to the very end. I'm talking we lost 8 inhibitors and every turret we had. Twice. TWICE we have all 3 inhibs down in our own base while the enemy team try and get in with baron. Twice we shove them out. My team scouts out and even though I am completely hesitant to leave the adc alone out in the wild I have to stay in the base, shoving what lanes I can and making sure the rengar doesn't sneak in, or the TF doesn't ult in for an easy backdoor.

In the end. Through all the most insane picks and plays. We won it. We took only 2 inhibs that game but god damn was it a game to remember.

It is on Replays.GG if anyone cares for a watch.

To the 4 randoms on my team. Cheers for not giving up!!

*Also. Sejuani support OP.

replies.body: Come back victories are soooooo satisfying!

That they are if the guys on your team aren't salty and half trolling 

It's happened to me before

Dayum, can I have the link to the game please. I'd very much like to see the time length of the game, and what happened at what time.
Btw, Sej Supp = CC queen xD (Part from Leona, she's just too heavy with cc ;-;)

I know the feeling, they had our nexus at 1 or 2 hits and still had full base turrets and inhib's, but we held it together and won, Which is a lesson to never surrender in ranked cos there is always a chance.
